name: src/components/countdown/useCountDown.js
TimeState
description:
Initial state for the countdown timer, representing the time left.
Each field (days, hours, minutes, seconds) is initialized to 0.

name: useCountDown
description:
Custom hook `useCountDown` that provides a countdown timer.
It calculates the time left until a given expiration date and updates the state every second.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} An object containing the time left in days, hours, minutes, and seconds.

params.name: params
params.description: Parameters for the hook.

params.name: params.expireDate
params.description: The expiration date in milliseconds.

return.description: An object containing the time left in days, hours, minutes, and seconds.

src/components/header/components/styles.js
DashboardNavbarRoot
description:
Styled component for the AppBar in the dashboard navigation bar.
Provides custom styles for padding, background color, and shadow.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: StyledToolBar
description:
Styled component for the Toolbar within the dashboard navigation bar.
Removes default padding and adjusts the height of the toolbar.

name: ToggleWrapper
description:
Styled component for a flex row that centers its content, used as a toggle button wrapper.
This component only becomes visible on screen sizes smaller than 'lg'.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: CustomButton
description:
Styled button component with custom height, padding, and margin.
The button becomes hidden on extra small screens ('xs').

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: StyledInputBase
description:
Styled input field with custom padding and background color.
The input becomes hidden on medium screens ('md') and smaller.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: src/components/header/hooks/use-header.js
useHeader
description:
Custom hook `useHeader` that manages the state for dialog, sidenav, and search bar visibility.
It provides functions to toggle each of these states.

unknown.tagValue:
{Object} An object containing the following states and toggle functions:
- `dialogOpen` {boolean}: State to determine if the dialog is open.
- `sidenavOpen` {boolean}: State to determine if the sidenav is open.
- `searchBarOpen` {boolean}: State to determine if the search bar is open.
- `toggleDialog` {Function}: Function to toggle the `dialogOpen` state.
- `toggleSidenav` {Function}: Function to toggle the `sidenavOpen` state.
- `toggleSearchBar` {Function}: Function to toggle the `searchBarOpen` state.

return.description:
An object containing the following states and toggle functions:
- `dialogOpen` {boolean}: State to determine if the dialog is open.
- `sidenavOpen` {boolean}: State to determine if the sidenav is open.
- `searchBarOpen` {boolean}: State to determine if the search bar is open.
- `toggleDialog` {Function}: Function to toggle the `dialogOpen` state.
- `toggleSidenav` {Function}: Function to toggle the `sidenavOpen` state.
- `toggleSearchBar` {Function}: Function to toggle the `searchBarOpen` state.

Defines the structure, labels, icons, and paths for different sections and items.

properties.description: The name of the navigation item.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The icon component used for the navigation item.

properties.name: path
properties.description: The path that the navigation item links to.

description:
A styled Material-UI Card component with custom dimensions, padding, and border radius.
This component is used to display content in a card layout with consistent styling.

unknown.tagValue: {JSX.Element} - A styled card component.

return.description: A styled card component.

name: src/components/page-sidenav/health-beauty-side-nav/styles/index.js
NavbarRoot
description:
A styled Material-UI Card component representing the root of the navbar.
It has a full height, no border radius, and uses relative positioning.

unknown.tagValue: {JSX.Element} - A styled Card component used as the root of the Navbar.

return.description: A styled Card component used as the root of the Navbar.

name: DotListItem
description:
A styled div that represents a list item in a dot list.
The list item contains a dot and text, and it changes the color of the dot on hover.

unknown.tagValue: {JSX.Element} - A div styled as a list item with hover effect on the dot.

params.name: theme
params.description: The theme object provided by Material-UI for consistent theming.

return.description: A div styled as a list item with hover effect on the dot.

name: Circle
description:
A styled div that represents a small circular dot.
The dot is used as an indicator in a list and its color changes on hover when used within `DotListItem`.

unknown.tagValue: {JSX.Element} - A div styled as a small circle.

params.name: theme
params.description: The theme object provided by Material-UI for consistent theming.

return.description: A div styled as a small circle.

name: src/components/product-card/styles/index.js
Card
description:
Styled component for a product card. When the card is hovered, the image zooms in,
and the product action buttons slide into view.

name: CardMedia
description:
Styled component for the media section of the product card, which maintains an aspect ratio,
has a background color, and hides any overflow. On hover, the image will animate.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: AddToCartButton
description: Styled IconButton for adding products to the cart. The button slides into view when the card is hovered.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: FavoriteButton
description: Styled IconButton for adding products to favorites. The button slides into view when the card is hovered.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: QuickViewButton
description: Styled button for quick view functionality. The button appears when the card is hovered.

name: src/components/product-card/use-product.js
useProduct
description:
Custom hook to manage product interactions such as toggling favorite status and opening a modal dialog.
Also integrates with the `notistack` library to display notifications.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - Contains the modal state, favorite state, and functions to toggle these states.
{boolean} openModal - Boolean indicating if the modal is open or closed.
{boolean} isFavorite - Boolean indicating if the product is marked as favorite.
{Function} toggleDialog - Function to toggle the modal's visibility.
{Function} toggleFavorite - Function to toggle the favorite status of the product.

params.name: slug
params.description: The slug or identifier for the product.

return.description: toggleFavorite - Function to toggle the favorite status of the product.

name: src/components/product-cards/product-card-1/styles/index.js
StyledBazaarCard
description:
Styled component for BazaarCard. It defines the layout, transitions, and hover effects for the card.
When hovered, elements inside the `.hover-box` will become visible.

name: ImageWrapper
description:
Styled component for wrapping images inside the BazaarCard. It centers the image and ensures it
takes up full width of the wrapper. On smaller screens, it adjusts to display as a block element.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: HoverIconWrapper
description:
Styled component for the hover icon container. It appears when the card is hovered, 
positioned in the top right corner with a smooth transition.

name: ContentWrapper
description:
Styled component for the content section of the BazaarCard. It defines padding, layout,
and ensures text elements like title and categories handle overflow gracefully by truncating.

Card
description:
Styled component for a product card. It defines the layout, background color, border, and hover effects.
On hover, the product actions slide into view, and the image is slightly zoomed.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: CardMedia
description:
Styled component for the media (image) section of the product card.
It ensures the image container takes full width and maintains a maximum height. 
On hover, the image animates with a zoom effect.

name: StyledIconButton
description:
Styled IconButton component for product action buttons (e.g., add to cart).
The button slides into view from the right when the card is hovered.

name: FavoriteButton
description:
Styled IconButton component for adding products to favorites.
The button slides into view from the right with a delay when the card is hovered.

Styled component for wrapping the image inside the Bazaar card. It handles responsiveness 
and displays hover effects, such as blurring the image and showing action buttons.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

description:
Styled component for the box that contains hover action buttons. 
It is initially hidden and becomes visible on hover, centered within the image wrapper.

name: ImageBox
description:
Styled component for the image container inside the Bazaar card. 
It centers the image and applies padding and background styling, with a hover effect that applies a blur.

name: ItemController
description:
Styled component for the item controller in the Bazaar card. It provides a flex layout with hover 
effects and includes an interactive span and icons. It also applies background and shadow effects.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: ContentWrapper
description:
Styled component for the content wrapper inside the Bazaar card. 
It adds padding and ensures text elements like title and categories handle overflow gracefully by truncating.

name: src/components/service-cards/service-card-3/styles.js
StyledRoot
description:
Styled component for a flexible layout container. It handles layout with gaps between elements, 
border styling, and responsive behavior for different screen sizes.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: src/components/settings/index.js
content: export { default } from "./setting";

name: src/components/settings/styles.js
MainContainer
description:
Styled component for the main container that holds the fixed position layout. 
It is positioned at the top-right of the screen and is hidden on medium and smaller screens.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: StyledIconButton
description:
Styled component for a floating IconButton. Positioned at the bottom-right of the screen with 
a fixed position and a circular appearance. The button has a shadow and hover effects.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: BodyWrapper
description:
Styled component for a wrapper that shows or hides content based on the `showBody` prop.
It manages the width, padding, opacity, and animation, making it slide in and out smoothly.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

params.name: showBody
params.description: Prop to control visibility and animation of the body.

name: StyledAvatar
description:
Styled component for an Avatar with hover effects. The avatar has a dynamic width, flex behavior, 
and a hover effect that darkens the image with a semi-transparent overlay.

name: src/components/side-nav/index.js
content: export { default } from "./side-nav";

name: src/components/sticky/index.js
content: export { default } from "./Sticky";

name: src/components/sticky/styles.js
slideDown
description:
Keyframe animation that moves the element from above the viewport (-200% Y-axis)
to its normal position (0 Y-axis), creating a sliding down effect.

name: StyledBox
description:
Styled component for a box that can be fixed at a certain position or be in its normal flow.
It includes animation for sliding down when fixed and has customizable properties for height and fixed positioning.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

params.name: componentHeight
params.description: The height to use when the component is fixed.

params.name: fixedOn
params.description: The offset from the top when the component becomes fixed.

params.name: fixed
params.description: Whether the component is in a fixed position.

content: export { default } from "./sticky-wrapper";

name: src/components/sticky-wrapper/styles.js
ContentWrapper
description:
Styled component for the main content wrapper, which manages the layout of the sidebar and content area.
The layout is responsive, hiding the sidebar on smaller screens and adjusting padding accordingly.

params.name: theme
params.description: MUI theme object for custom styling.

name: src/components/stories/story-content/index.js

name: src/components/stories/story-content/styles.js
StyledRoot
description:
Styled component for the root container. It is a flexible container that takes up the full width 
and height of its parent, with relative positioning to manage child components' positioning.

name: StyledButton
description:
Styled Button component that is positioned absolutely at the bottom of the parent container.
It is horizontally centered, has a high `z-index`, and features inline padding.

name: src/components/stories/story-item/index.js
content: export { default } from "./story-item";

name: src/components/stories/story-item/styles.js
StyledRoot
description:
Styled component for a root container that is interactive (clickable) and has a flexible layout.
It includes styling for rounded corners, hidden overflow, and removes the default outline for better UX.

name: src/components/stories/story-viewer/index.js
content: export { default } from "./story-viewer";

name: src/components/stories/story-viewer/styles.js
ModalWrapper
description:
Styled component for a modal wrapper. This modal is centered on the screen both horizontally and vertically, 
with a fixed aspect ratio, rounded corners, and a white background. The `translate` function is used to 
perfectly center the modal.

name: src/components/trunc-paragraph/index.js
content: export { default } from "./trunc-paragraph";

name: src/data/categoriesMegaMenu.js
categoriesMegaMenu
description:
Mega menu categories data structure, containing various categories and subcategories for use in navigation.
Each category may have children with further nested items, and some entries include icons or images for display.

name: src/data/countryList.js
countries
description:
Array of country objects, each containing a label (the country's name) and a value (the country's code).
This array is useful for dropdowns or selection components where users choose a country.

name: src/data/months-years.js
months
description: Array of months in a year, starting from January to December.

name: years
description: Array of years from 2021 to 2032.

name: src/data/navbarNavigation.js
megaMenus
description:
Mega menu configurations for various sections such as Home, User Account, Vendor Account, and Sale Page.
Each section contains nested subcategories, URLs, and configurations for mega menus.

name: src/data/navigations.js
categoryMenus
description:
Category menus configuration, each containing an icon, title, href, and a nested structure for subcategories.
Some categories have a mega menu component and an offer configuration, which includes an image and link.

name: src/firebaseAdmin.jsx
adminAuth
description: Admin Auth instance for handling authentication operations via Firebase Admin SDK.

name: adminDb
description: Admin Firestore instance for interacting with the Firestore database via Firebase Admin SDK.

name: adminStorage
description: Admin Storage instance for interacting with Firebase Storage via Firebase Admin SDK.

name: src/firebaseConfig.jsx
firebaseConfig
description:
Firebase configuration object for initializing Firebase in a web app.
For Firebase JS SDK v7.20.0 and later, the `measurementId` is optional.
Values are pulled from environment variables for security and flexibility.

properties.name: apiKey
properties.description: Firebase API key (from the environment variable NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_API_KEY)

properties.name: authDomain
properties.description: Firebase Auth domain (from the environment variable NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_AUTH_DOMAIN)

properties.name: projectId
properties.description: Firebase Project ID (from the environment variable NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID)

properties.name: storageBucket
properties.description: Firebase storage bucket (from the environment variable NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_STORAGE_BUCKET)

properties.name: messagingSenderId
properties.description: Firebase messaging sender ID (from the environment variable NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_MESSAGING_SENDER_ID)

properties.name: appId
properties.description: Firebase app ID (from the environment variable NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_APP_ID)

name: app
description: Initialize Firebase app only if there are no existing Firebase app instances.

name: db
description: Firestore database instance for interacting with the Firestore database.

name: auth
description: Firebase Authentication instance for managing authentication-related operations.

name: storage
description: Firebase Storage instance for managing file storage operations.

name: src/hooks/useMuiTable.js
descendingComparator
description: Compares two objects based on a specific property, returning a result for descending order.

unknown.tagValue: {number} - Returns -1, 0, or 1 based on the comparison.

params.name: a
params.description: First object to compare.

params.name: b
params.description: Second object to compare.

params.name: orderBy
params.description: The property name to compare the objects by.

return.description: Returns -1, 0, or 1 based on the comparison.

name: getComparator
description: Returns a comparator function based on the sort order ("asc" or "desc").

unknown.tagValue: {Function} - Comparator function to use for sorting.

params.name: order
params.description: Sort order, either "asc" or "desc".

params.name: orderBy
params.description: The property to sort by.

return.description: Comparator function to use for sorting.

name: stableSort
description: Sorts an array stably using a comparator function, maintaining the original order for equal elements.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} - The sorted array.

params.name: array
params.description: The array to sort.

params.name: comparator
params.description: Comparator function for sorting.

return.description: The sorted array.

name: useMuiTable
description: Custom hook for managing table data, sorting, pagination, and selection in a MUI (Material-UI) table.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - Returns state and functions for handling table behavior (sorting, pagination, selection).

params.name: props
params.description: Properties for the table data and default sorting options.

params.name: props.listData
params.description: The data to display in the table.

params.name: props.defaultSort
params.description: The default column to sort by (default is "name").

params.name: props.defaultOrder
params.description: The default sorting order ("asc" or "desc").

return.description: Returns state and functions for handling table behavior (sorting, pagination, selection).

name: src/hooks/useOverflowDetect.js
useOverflowDetect
description:
Custom hook to detect if an element overflows horizontally to the left or right side of the viewport.
This hook is useful for responsive layouts or detecting when content is outside the visible area.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - The reference to the element, overflow state, and the function to check for overflow.
{Object} elementRef - A ref to attach to the DOM element you want to monitor.
{boolean} isLeftOverflowing - Boolean indicating if the element is overflowing to the left.
{boolean} isRightOverflowing - Boolean indicating if the element is overflowing to the right.
{Function} checkOverflow - Function to manually trigger the overflow check.

return.description: checkOverflow - Function to manually trigger the overflow check.

name: src/hooks/useScroller.js
useScroller
description:
Custom hook to detect when the user has scrolled past a certain point and fix the header or any element
at the top of the viewport. The hook monitors the vertical scroll position and compares it with the 
height of a referenced element.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - An object containing `isFixedHeader`, a boolean indicating if the header should be fixed.

params.name: ref
params.description: A React reference to the element being monitored for scroll position.

return.description: An object containing `isFixedHeader`, a boolean indicating if the header should be fixed.

name: src/hooks/useSettings.js
useSettings
description:
Custom hook to access the settings stored in the `SettingsContext`.
This hook provides an easy way to access and manage global settings throughout the application.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - The current settings and any associated methods provided by the `SettingsContext`.

return.description: The current settings and any associated methods provided by the `SettingsContext`.

name: src/hooks/useWindowSize.js
useWindowSize
description:
Custom hook that returns the current window width and updates the width on window resize events.
The hook uses a debounced listener to optimize performance by limiting how often the resize handler is called.

unknown.tagValue: {number} - The current width of the window.

return.description: The current width of the window.

name: src/i18n/index.js
src/i18n/resource.js
resources
description:
Object containing translation resources for different languages.
Each language (e.g., `en` for English, `es` for Spanish) has a `translation` object
that maps specific keys to their translated values.

name: src/icons/duotone/index.js
modules
description:
Object that consolidates all feature modules into a single exportable entity.
Each key corresponds to a specific feature, and the associated value is the respective module/component.

This structure allows for easy access to multiple features within the application
by simply importing the `modules` object, making the codebase more modular and manageable.

name: src/icons/index.js
appIcons
description:
An object containing all imported icon components, mapped by name.
This allows the application to reference and use these icons in a modular way.

CategoryWrapper
description:
A styled box component that represents a category label with custom padding, border radius, and background color.
Used for displaying category tags or labels in a consistent style.

name: StyledIconButton
description:
A styled IconButton with custom colors and hover effects for the icons inside.
The button color changes on hover to the theme's `info` color.

name: StyledTableRow
description:
A styled table row with custom behavior for the last child and selected state.
The row does not show a border for the last cell and handles hover and selection transparently.

name: StyledTableCell
description:
A styled table cell component with custom font size, padding, and border color.
Used for creating consistent table cell styling across the application.

name: StatusWrapper
description:
A styled box component to display the status of an item with dynamic colors based on the `status` prop.
Different statuses (e.g., "Accepted", "Rejected", "Processing") have distinct color combinations.

params.name: status
params.description: The status of the item (e.g., "Accepted", "Rejected", "Processing").

name: UploadImageBox
description:
A styled box component for displaying an image upload area with a custom background and size.
The box has rounded corners and is centered both horizontally and vertically.

name: StyledClear
description:
A styled `Clear` icon positioned absolutely within its container.
It has a small size, clickable cursor, and is used to represent a clear or close action.

usePasswordVisible

Custom hook to manage the visibility state of a password input field.
Provides a `togglePasswordVisible` function to switch between showing and hiding the password.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - The current visibility state and a function to toggle the visibility.
{boolean} visiblePassword - Boolean indicating if the password is visible.
{Function} togglePasswordVisible - Function to toggle the password visibility.

return.description: togglePasswordVisible - Function to toggle the password visibility.

name: src/theme/theme-colors.js
grey
description:
Shades of grey used in the application, from light to dark.
Used for text, borders, backgrounds, and other UI elements.

name: primary
description: Shades of primary color used for key UI elements and highlights.

name: secondary
description: Shades of secondary color used for accents and secondary UI elements.

name: error
description: Shades of error color used for error states and warnings.

name: success
description: Shades of success color used for success states and confirmations.

name: blue
description: Shades of blue used for information states or neutral elements.

name: marron
description: Shades of marron color used for certain highlights and UI accents.

name: paste
description: Shades of paste (pastel green) used for softer UI elements and highlights.

name: orange
description: Shades of orange used for warning or attention-grabbing elements.

name: bluish
description: Shades of bluish color used for accentuating UI elements.

name: warning
description: Shades of warning color used for warnings and alerts.

name: gold
description: Gold color used for premium or high-priority elements.

name: dark
description: Dark color used for general dark mode elements.

name: white
description: White color used for backgrounds or text in dark mode.

name: themeColors
description:
Collection of theme colors used throughout the application.
Contains references to individual color objects such as primary, secondary, error, and success.

name: src/theme/typography.js
fontSize
description: Default font size used throughout the application.

name: typography
description:
Typography settings for the application, including base font size, HTML font size, and font family.
This object defines the global typography rules that can be used consistently across the application.

name: src/theme/utils.js
classes

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - An object where each key is a class name, and the value is a CSS style object.

return.description: An object where each key is a class name, and the value is a CSS style object.

name: src/utils/constants.js
content:
/**
 * Object containing layout constants used throughout the application.
 * These constants define various dimensions related to the layout, such as heights for the header,
 * topbar, and navigation elements, as well as container widths and sidebar dimensions.
 * 
 * @constant
 * @type {Object}
 */
export const layoutConstant = {
  topbarHeight: 40,         // Height of the top bar in pixels
  headerHeight: 80,         // Height of the header in pixels
  mobileNavHeight: 64,      // Height of the mobile navigation in pixels
  containerWidth: 1200,     // Maximum container width in pixels
  mobileHeaderHeight: 64,   // Height of the mobile header in pixels
  grocerySidenavWidth: 280  // Width of the grocery sidebar in pixels
};

/**
 * Constant defining the user storage limit.
 * This sets a 5GB limit for user storage, represented in bytes.
 * 
 * @constant
 * @type {number}
 */
const USER_STORAGE_LIMIT = 5 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024; // 5GB in bytes

name: layoutConstant
description:
Object containing layout constants used throughout the application.
These constants define various dimensions related to the layout, such as heights for the header,
topbar, and navigation elements, as well as container widths and sidebar dimensions.

name: USER_STORAGE_LIMIT
description:
Constant defining the user storage limit.
This sets a 5GB limit for user storage, represented in bytes.

content:
# Pariahs Fans





## Documentation

Documentation for the architecture of this project is released in a dedicated document and will be released and linked here once the project is finished and the documentation is completed.

## Contributions

Pariah is Open Source with Apache 2 license and any contribution is welcome. Read more about how to contribute in the [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) file.

## How to run

This project is built with Firebase and uses Firestore as a database. To get started, you need to have a Firebase project set up and the Firebase CLI installed on your computer. See the following instructions to set up your development environment.

### Prerequisites

Before you get started, make sure you have the following software installed on your computer:

- [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/download/)
- Firebase CLI: `npm install -g firebase-tools firebase`

If you have never worked with firebase, here's some good starting points: 

- [Get started with Firebase](https://firebase.google.com/docs/web/setup)
- [React Tutorial](https://blog.logrocket.com/firebase-cloud-storage-firebase-v9-react/)

### Firebase Emulators

To run with firebase emulators, first setup the firebase project. When setting up hosting on firebase, you get the relevant information to create a `.env.local` file in the root of the repository (it's part of `.gitignore`, don't worry about commiting it). 

Set up [Authentication with Google]() and find the relevant SDK secrets.

Your `.env.local` should look something like this:

```
GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID=<env-from-authentication>
GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET=<env-from-authentication>

// Relevant for QR Code generation
NEXT_PUBLIC_BASE_URL=http://localhost:5003


NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_API_KEY=<env-from-hosting>
NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_AUTH_DOMAIN=<env-from-hosting>
NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID=<env-from-hosting>
NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_STORAGE_BUCKET=<env-from-hosting>
NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_MESSAGING_SENDER_ID=<env-from-hosting>
NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_APP_ID="<env-from-hosting>"
```

YOu can start up the emulator suite by running the following command:

```bash
firebase emulators:start
```

This will start up the Firestore emulator and other relevant services which are required for this project. You can find the port on which the emulator is exposed in the output of the command:

```bash
...
│ ✔  All emulators ready! It is now safe to connect your app. │
│ i  View Emulator UI at http://127.0.0.1:4000/
...
```

You will need to add this to `next.config.js` (To Read images from the emulated firestorage):

```
const nextConfig = {
  images: {
    remotePatterns: [
...
      // Firebase Local (Dev Only)
      { protocol: "http", hostname: "127.0.0.1", port: "9199" },
    ]
  }
};
```

If you see older versions of the emulator, you can clear the cash. The only implication of this, is that deployments are slower (because this directory is used to cache the emulator images). But it's safe to remove:

```bash
rm -rf .firebase
```

### Node Version

If you have newer or older Node.js Versions locally, you can use [`n`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/n) to switch between versions. Install it with:

```shell
npm install -g n
```

Use the given version:

```shell
n run node/20.12.2


Welcome to Node.js v20.12.2.
Type ".help" for more information.
```

A known version to work (also supported by firebase-cli) is `v20.12.2`

### Structure


## `.github/`

Contains relevant Github metadata and workflow configurations

## `/docs`


## Tools

Additional Tools which help with the development of this project.

### Esdoc

To generate documentation for the project, you can use `esdoc`. Install it with:

```shell
npm install -g esdoc
```

And run it with:

```shell
esdoc
```
name: ./README.md

content:
{
    "name": "pariahs-fans",
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "private": true,
    "scripts": {
        "dev": "next dev",
        "build": "next build",
        "start": "next start",
        "lint": "next lint",
        "unit-test": "firebase emulators:exec 'npm run test'",
        "test": "jest",
        "e2e": "npx playwright test",
        "e2e-test": "firebase emulators:exec 'npm run e2e'",
        "fix:prettier": "prettier --write . '!.next' '!.node_modules' '!tools/output/**/.next'"
    },

name: package.json
